transcripts.text: Okay, so it's 5 o'clock and you've stopped me under the Road Traffic Act, that's fine.  So how can I help you?  Would you like me to move somewhere so you're not standing in the road?

I would like you to provide us with your details, a copy of your driving licence and a copy of your insurance.  And then I'd like to speak to you about the manner of your driving.  Now, as a police officer and as a person, I'm pretty laid back with things.
Yeah, me too.  However...

Bearing in mind it's a 20 mile per hour speed limit round here, you came to undertake me first of all in the bus lane, doing over 20 miles an hour, because I was doing 20 and you came up the inside of me.  You then waved and allowed me to get in front
of you,

and then on the next bit of the bus lane you undertook me and undertook the car in front in a 20 mile per hour speed limit when I was doing 20 mile per hour in our police vehicle.  So I'd like to speak to you about the manner of your driving.
Right, okay.  So which would you like to do first?
I'd like to check your details through, so I can have a copy of your driving license.

That's a copy.  Can we have a look at it, please?  No, because this is just a copy for the copy.

I recommend everyone carries their documents as I do myself.
